messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm trapped on the backside of a forest fire. I need help.
Where are you at?
I don't know exactly. I'm in a clear cut area right near the fire.
What's going on?
I was walking through the woods, and suddenly the fire started circling around me.
Is your house nearby?
Yes, it's at 238 South Alice. I was walking along deer trails, trying to get away because the fire is coming fast through the grass.
Okay, 238 South Alice. Do you know if you are east, north, south, or west of your house?
I have no idea.
I've got your number. I'm going to call the sheriff.
I see airplanes.
Okay, stay on the phone with me. Don't hang up. You have an emergency right now.
The fire was close to my house and I got lost. I'm on the deer trail now.
Alright, stay on with me. What's your name?
Michael Fritz.
Okay, Michael, is the fire on you yet?
No, ma'am. I'm on the deer trail now.
Are you seeing anyone or anything around you?
No, ma'am.
Can you see the fire?
Yes, ma'am. I see the fire, but no one is around.
Can you hear any sirens or see any vehicles?
No, ma'am. Just a lot of smoke.
Can you wave something to signal to the planes above?
I see a plane coming close. The fire is getting closer.
Stay on the line. Can you see the sun or any landmarks?
No, ma'am. The fire is surrounding me.
Can you move towards a different direction away from the fire?
I don't know which way to go. The flames are on me.
Try moving towards an area with less smoke. Can you do that?
I'm trying. It's so smoky.
Describe your surroundings. Are you near any clearings or trails?
I'm in a pine thicket. I think I'm on a deer trail road.
Okay, keep moving. Are you heading towards the sirens?
I hear the sirens. They're to my right.
Keep moving towards the sirens. Do you see any vehicles yet?
Yes, there's a cop car up ahead.
Stay where you are. They've got you. Are you okay?
Yes, I think so. They got me.
